values:
Ooooh, I'm scared. I really, really am. How the fuck do I lie down at around 3:13, and promptly sleep until 7:55? I mean, when I woke up and heard it was "a quarter to eight", I initially thought it was eight AM. I swear I'm losing my mind. This is just the latest in a string of moments and times where I literally feared for my sanity.
  • There are small moments every once in a while where I actually feel amazed, or surprised, whatever, to be... alive? On Earth? Not a cartoon? What? This is one of the hardest things in the world to describe. Just the sensation of this I-can't-get-used-to-this/I-can't-take-this-for-granted-again feeling. Being amazed over physical objects, and... I don't know. What I keep wondering is why I'm astounded by these little things, because what, exactly, am I comparing it to? Sleep? Cartoons--the little two-dimensional world? Death? It used to happen only once every few months, but then it occurred each couple of weeks, and now it's like it's almost every damn day.
  • I've been completely freaked out lately by the fear of losing my mind. A few years back I read a Sweet Valley High Senior Year book where one of the characters mused, "When you lose your mind, do you know you're losing it?" I forgot all about it until just a couple months ago. Now it's nearly all I think about. How do I know if I'm going insane? And is there anything I can do to stop it?
  • Nothing is sure for me anymore, it seems. This is one of the most recently-occurring things. Like, it started with doubt about a certain subject (that I won't get into right now), and then it just seemed to spread like a freaking wildfire. Now I'm not completely sure if the sky is blue, if gravity exists completely, if I'm actually eighteen-and-a-quarter years old... I always wonder, "How do we know? How do we know for sure? We don't!"
  • I can't just laugh at stupid things without first considering them. Like, people saying something along the lines of, "...makes as much sense as watching TV upside down while pulling out all your hairs." Most people would just snicker and roll their eyes, but I actually go into the motives of why a person would do that. Like, "Maybe they want to watch TV in a weird position. And the hair thing? Maybe they want to count their hairs." Lately nothing is exempt from that.
I know there's not that many "insane moments", but it's not the number of different ones, it's how many times I have the ones listed: if not every single day, just about every single day, then. It's very frustrating--and frightening.

...because I did that and slept during the murder scene.  What's weird?  This is the dream I had.  Excuse the poor punctuation--I was in that kind of mood when I wrote it down, and I just pasted it straight into the box.

	i was wandering down this road with a notebook in my hands.  deep  between a couple of the pages was a knife i'd been using to injure myself with.  for some reason it was like the road was one hell of a long room, and i was walking along a table.  i put the notebook down between some books and bottles of soda or something, and then walked on.  later on my mom was walking with me and she needed a notebook.  she went to pick up the notebook with the knife and i snatched it up, babbling some excuse about why it wasn't good.  so she went to get another one, but this new one had some of my bloodstains in it in shapes of words and whatnot.  she finally gave up, and picked up a lamp to write on (don't ask). some time later i was walking down the road thing with a friend of mine. it was like it was for some macbeth project or something.  we saw projects strewn along the road--not discarded, it was like people were putting them there as they would in their rooms, i.e. carelessly and messily.  this one had fake blood with it, spread everywhere--recreating the murder of duncan, it may have been.  and there were a couple other murder scenes as well.  at one point the girl with me walked away without me noticing. a bit later i was watching some crime scene person investigating the fake murder projects.  turns out there was real blood mixed in with the fake stuff.  either there had been an actual murder, or there was a suicide, that had been covered up by a simple school project.  i would have found out sooner, but i was woken up quite suddenly. 

It kind of made me wonder if anyone's actually gotten away with killing somebody and covering the blood up with paint or something.

New sites! New people! New, new, new! Fucking pop-ups: Nude? Me: I said NEW, not nude. Now go away. Fucking pop-ups: *pouting, but shutting up* I just found a bunch of new sites: www.meetup.com explodingdog.com www.deadjournal.com (?!) And am meeting new people on Television Without Pity. Yay! New stuff rules! (Isn't it amazing that a mere three hours ago I was sobbing and slicing open my leg... damn, wonder if my jeans are stained...) On Exploding Dog, I love the "normal" sounding titles that seem so boring, but then are drawn literally. For example: Sucks To Be You They Want To See Me On TV He Wanted To Write, But Something Held Him Back You Are My Sunshine I Talk To Myself It is sooo easy to kill hours there. Just lose track of time, clicking, clicking, and clicking some more. I love it! Whoo hoo! This burst of shallowness has been brought to you because I already posted today and I can be shallow if I want to. Nyeah. So there. ;)

Why the FUCK are our library computers so FUCKED UP? It seems like these always happen: You're online with several browser windows open. You: Hmm. I think I'll close this browser window. I don't need it anymore. You click the X at a single browser's window. Computer: Muahahahahaha! You have DONE. THE. UNTHINKABLE! MUAHAHAHAHA! Every single browser window closes. You lose an entry for Live Journal, a post for Television Without Pity, and two emails you were in the middle of typing. You: Noooooo!!!!!! You're browsing through a site and realize you really like a story. You: Oooh. Me like this story. Me want to copy-and-paste it so me can read it at home. Or some variation on the above line. You select the story and copy it. You paste it into word. Computer: Aww, fuck, it's got a table. Why the hell does she copy and paste tables? I hate them! Oooh, I know, I'll piss her off by delaying the actual pasting of the story! Twenty minutes later: The computer finally stops making you wait and actually has the story pasted. You: Aaaaaaah!!!!!! You're at school, where the filtering system is insane. You: Hmm. I think I'll go to [Enter random G-rated, non sexual, non violent site here].com. You type in the address. The filtering system has decided you aren't allowed to go there. Computer screen: You cannot go to this site. It has profanity and nudity and sex and lotsa bad stuff. Plus it's a "free" site, so we don't like it. You: It has no "bad stuff." It doesn't even have actual pictures! Several pop-ups make it through the filtering. Fucking pop-ups: Nude pictures of [actress]! Do you want nude pictures of hot celebrity chicks? Nude pictures of [singer]! Don't you want naked pictures of butt-fuckers?? You: Not right now, thanks. Fucking pop-ups: BUT THEY'RE NAAAAAKED! You: I said, not right now! Not ever! Fucking pop-ups: You must not have heard me. Here, I'll even do you a favor and activate the site myself. Magically, the site opens, miraculously bypassing the filtering system. You quickly close the site and exit completely off the Internet for fear of being banned forever from school computers. You: Aaaaaaah!!!!!! You want to use Internet Explorer at school, rather than Netscape Navigator, because every time you go to Television Without Pity, NN crashes. You: Ahh, Internet Explorer. The non-TWoP-hating browser. You click on the infamous "e" icon. Fucking pop-ups: I'M BACK, BI-ATTCHH!! You: Nooooooooo!!!!!! The CD-ROM drive shoves itself out into the open. Fucking pop-ups: Did your CD-ROM open? If so, YOU HAVE SPYWARE AND NEED TO UNINSTALL IT!!! You: This isn't even my fucking computer!!! You're using the nauseatingly slow computer at the library. You: I wanna go through the TWoP forums. You click on a thread. Fucking pop-ups: Damn. There are no pop-ups on that site. I can't piss her off. Sigh. Wait. I can't directly piss her off--Hey! Computer! Could you help me out a sec? Computer: Sure. What could I do? Fucking pop-ups: I'll do you favors if you take five hours to go to each page. Whaddaya say? Computer: Would you tickle me by popping up on every single pop-up site later on? Fucking pop-ups: Yeah. Computer: Done. Deal. An hour later you're still waiting for the thread to load. You: Aaaaaaah!!!!!!

Ever have a dream you just do not want to wake up from? I had one Sunday morning, after I went back to bed for a bit. I was like, in some kind of garage, talking to my friend Cara. We were having a sleepover of some sort--in the garage for some reason (hey, it's a dream, logic does not apply). We talked for hours and then, the next thing I knew, we were.... Well, the next part I'll keep to myself. It's just for me to know. I just hope Cara never finds out I dreamed about her. Aww. Finally a sweet dream. I like not having nightmares.

I am both frustrated and exhausted. Like, "What the fuck? I can't have one day where nothing goes wrong?" It's gotten to the point where I'm sitting back and just taking it. Okay. First of all, last Friday morning, I was trying to save some tarot things from my computer to a disk so I could print them out at school (I don't have a printer at home). Well, guess what? It fucked up. It fucked up on six disks. And when I finally got to school, a whopping ZERO of the disks worked on the school's computer(s). I tried three school computers, too! "That's okay," I told myself. "Bad disks." So yesterday (Monday) night, I found my newer ones and formatted them on my laptop. Then I tried to use some on my main computer (cause that's where most of my stuff is) to save the stuff on disks. But guess what? My disk drive is broken on the main computer. That means I have no way out. Ever hear the metaphor that a computer is a room, and a printer and disk drives are the windows, and the Internet is a door? Well, my door is locked and one window's been frozen shut for years. Now the other window just locked by itself. I have no way of moving stuff from the main computer--unless I had the laptop with me and typed everything directly from the main comp. But even I don't have that kind of patience, and that wouldn't work on photos anyway. Oh, and here's the kicker for the "Okay my life truly IS shitty I accept it": Thursday afternoon in German class, this kid--we'll call him Evilly Truculent--insulted me. "You drive like a [fucking] six year old[, you little bitch who doesn't deserve to drive]. You're the [world's] worst driver[that ever lived]." And then he laughed. Okay, I know you're just saying, "So what? Who cares what he thinks?" Yeah? You don't know what happened in October. (Kaiya, you've heard this before.) Early in October I was driving to school, exhausted from lack of sleep. I went to turn into a row of the parked cars, but I was too narrow on one side and hit a teacher's truck. (By the way: What the FUCK was the teacher doing parking in the student parking lot???) Touch your nose, grazing lightly--THAT'S how hard I hit. There wasn't even any paint damage. Yet for some reason, the Law of Three came back the next week to bite me in the ass for being rude to my friend and to my sister. We got polls we were supposed to fill out. With "worst driver" as an option. Yes, that week I saw at least 15 people vote for me. Now, that may not bother other people--in fact guys were fighting over being voted worst guy driver--but it did me. One look at the scars I gave myself over the bumping-the-truck incident and you'd know how badly I felt--and still feel. I cried for a week straight. And just when I thought I was getting better, I get slammed in the face again. I told this one girl Rachel Walker to tell people not to vote for me (she saw me crying and asked what was wrong), but I don't think that's enough. I'm naturally hard on myself--in fact I deny myself guilty pleasures such as laughing loud or imagining cheesy things to happen. And--AGAIN!--my one mistake comes back to slap me in the face again. Like the literal slap I gave myself wasn't enough??? Sigh. I must have, like, been John Wilkes Booth or Jack The Ripper in a past life. Or something. 'Cause my happy moments are few and far between.
